TEI:
&teiHeader; &facsimile;
55 Vita sancti Bartholomei.
SEint Bartelmev þe holie man &punctelev; cam of kingues blode
Sw&ydot;þe fair man and noble he was &punctelev; and glad & of swete mode
he siwede &orrot;e louerd on e&orrot;þe here &punctelev; are he deide on þe rode
And isaiȝ is p&rrot;iuetez &punctelev; with þe oþere Apo&slong;tles guode
Þo &orrot;e louerd was to heouene iwent &punctelev; he p&rrot;echede of him wel fa&slong;te
And wende wide in mani a lond &punctelev; þe ȝw&ydot;le is lijf ila&slong;te
So þat to þe londe of .Inde &punctelev; he cam þ&orrot;uȝ godes Godes wille
At þe onende of þe lond &punctelev; he bilefde wel &slong;tille
Ase an vncouth pilegrim &punctelev; he ȝeode up and doun
he ne seide neiþer on ne oþur &punctelev; bote biheold þane toun
In þe temple was a fals god &punctelev; a maumet luþur inovȝ
Þareinne was þe feond of helle &punctelev; and muche folk to him d&rrot;ovȝ
¶hu&ydot; cleopeden þat Maumet A&slong;taroth. &punctelev; þat þ&orrot;uȝ þe deoueles miȝte
Ofte he wolde Answerie men &punctelev; and manie[MS. nanie] he binam heom he&orrot;e siȝte
he&orrot;e speche and he&orrot;e limes also &punctelev; and dude[MS. duden] men wo inovȝ
& ȝwane he aȝen ani sick man cam[om. cam] &punctelev; of his vuele he[r. him] withd&rrot;ouȝ
Þanne was þe sike man hol anon &punctelev; ase he mo&slong;te nede amende
Ȝwane he ne hadde non oþur vuel &punctelev; bote ase þe schrewe him sende
And he withd&rrot;ovȝ him of is vuel &punctelev; he mo&slong;te nede hol beo
Þe schrewe tolde þe men þanne &punctelev; þat þis wonder miȝten iseo
Þat he hadde þ&orrot;uȝ is miȝte &punctelev; þe men imaud hol inovȝ
And þei[r. Alþei?] þe schrewe ne dude non oþur guod &punctelev; bote of is vuele him withd&rrot;ouȝ
Þaref&orrot;e sike men al dai &punctelev; ful þicke aboute him souȝte
And criden on him wel deolfulliche &punctelev; þat he to hele heom b&rrot;ouȝte
¶Of þingue þat was also f&orrot;to come &punctelev; men axeden him fe&orrot; and ne&orrot;
And he heom tolde of alle þing &punctelev; þ&orrot;uȝ þe deoueles pouwer
Folk cam þicke abouten him &punctelev; bi daiȝe and bi niȝte
And he ansuerede heom of al þat hu&ydot; wolden &punctelev; muche is þe deoueles miȝte!
Ake after þat seint Seint Bartelmev &punctelev; to þulke cite com
Þe power of þat false god &punctelev; clanliche he binom:
F&orrot; he ne miȝte aftur þulke t&ydot;me &punctelev; with[al. f&orrot;] no man speke riȝt nouȝt
Ne ȝiuen Ansuere of noþing &punctelev; so he was bineoþe ib&rrot;ouȝt
Þat folk cam þicke aboute him &punctelev; to witen at him he&orrot;e wille
Of þingues ase hu&ydot; weren bif&orrot;e iwoned &punctelev; and euere he was pu&ydot;r &slong;tille
Þaref&orrot;e was wonder inovȝ &punctelev; deol and s&orrot; also
hu&ydot; weren aferd to beon f&orrot;l&orrot;e &punctelev; and þat hu&ydot; hadden ouȝt misdo:
to atoun hu&ydot; wenden þarebiside &punctelev; þ&orrot;uȝ he&orrot;e alre wit
to an oþur Maumet þat was his felawe &punctelev; þat hu&ydot; cleopeden berit
hu&ydot; crieden on him wel deolfulliche &punctelev; þat he heom tolde f&orrot;e
Ȝwi A&slong;taroth he&orrot;e owene god &punctelev; his speche hadde f&orrot;l&orrot;e
Ȝe ȝe" seide þis luþere be&slong;t &punctelev; "ȝe ne witen nouȝt hou it is?
with &slong;trongue chaines al fu&ydot;rie &punctelev; he is ibounde iwis
F&orrot; Bartelmev godes Godes seriaunt &punctelev; þat is þudere icome
And in þe cite geth wel &slong;tilledeliche &punctelev; and[al. om.] is power him hath binome
And ibounde him so fa&slong;te þat he ne ma&ydot; &punctelev; enes d&rrot;awe is b&rrot;eth
Ake þ&orrot;uȝ Anguische is clene ouercome &punctelev; ase þei he hadde iþoled deth
¶Ȝwat is [he] þilke Bartelmeuȝ" &punctelev; þeos oþere him axeden anon
Þat mai makien &orrot;e almiȝtie god &punctelev; ded so an&ydot; &slong;ton?"
he is" seide þis Maumat &punctelev; "of gret pouwer ase ȝe iseoth
he mai do with us al þat he wole &punctelev; f&orrot; bineothþe him we beoth
Eche daie an hund&rrot;et siþe &punctelev; and oþur swuch bi niȝte
he knevleth to is god in guode entente &punctelev; þat ȝifth him al is miȝte
Aungles with him inowe he hath &punctelev; ȝwareþ&orrot;uȝ þat he ma&ydot; do
Al þat he wole with us alle &punctelev; and alle þing he wot also
F&orrot; he wot nouþe þare ase he is &punctelev; al &orrot;e speche and &orrot;e þouȝt
Þaref&orrot;e ich rede eov alle wel &punctelev; þat ȝe ne wrathþi him nouȝt
echmanere speche þat is &punctelev; he knoweth and speket also
bote at one w&orrot;de alle þing &punctelev; he wot ȝwat is ido
Ȝif ȝe him sechez þei ȝe come &punctelev; riȝt bi him ase he is
Ȝe ne schulle him nouȝt iseo &punctelev; bote himseolf wolle iwis
Ake þus ȝe him mouwe iknowe &punctelev; ȝif ȝe him iseo
he is swiþe long of bodi &punctelev; of riȝt fair fourme and freo
Op&rrot;iȝt he geoth and euene inovȝ &punctelev; and swiþe ȝwijȝt is his bleo
his her is b&rrot;oun and swiþe crips &punctelev; non ne mai crips&orrot;e beo
Muchele e&ydot;ȝene and euene nose &punctelev; i&slong;treiȝt adoun along
his berd is long and sid inouȝ &punctelev; and sumdel h&orrot; among
In a ȝwijȝt Golioun he geth &punctelev; he nath cloþes non mo
Alle þis sixeandtwenti ȝer &punctelev; þarinne he hath igo
Þat fram him it neuereft ne cam &punctelev; ne hit ne apeirez nouȝt of hewe
Ne f&orrot;oldeth nouȝt withalle &punctelev; ake is euere iliche newe
Wel he wot al þat ȝe spekez &punctelev; and ȝwat ȝe doth alle here
Þaref&orrot;e ȝif he eou axeth ouȝt &punctelev; ȝe ne mowen eou nouȝt skere
Ake ȝif he him sewi[al. schewe] so &punctelev; þat ȝe him mowe iseo
biddez him f&orrot; his louerdes loue &punctelev; þat he beo milde to me
Þat he ne come nouȝt here neiȝ me &punctelev; þat ich beo to grounde ib&rrot;ouȝt
And it&orrot;mented ase mi felawe is &punctelev; f&orrot; inelle misdon him nouȝt
¶Þo þis fole men þis ihe&orrot;den &punctelev; hu&ydot; weren in gret þouȝt
And longue heom þouȝte are hu&ydot; hadden &punctelev; seint Bartelmevȝ isouȝt
hu&ydot; wende aȝen to he&orrot;e owene temple &punctelev; ake hu&ydot; weren alle blinde
twei daiȝes hu&ydot; souȝten him fa&slong;te &punctelev; and ne miȝten him nouȝwere ifinde
A dai ase al þat folk &punctelev; to þe temple was ib&rrot;ouȝt
f&orrot;to honouri he&orrot;e false god &punctelev; þat ne miȝte heom helpe nouȝt
A gu&ydot;di man þare cam also &punctelev; þat þe deuel hadde ibeo longue
In him and binomen him is wit &punctelev; and it&orrot;mented him ful &slong;trongue
Anon so þis gidie man &punctelev; into þis temple cam
Þe deuel þat in him was &punctelev; gret deol to him nam
wel loude he gradde " seint Seint Bartelmeuȝ &punctelev; ich biseche þe
Þine &orrot;esones b&rrot;ennez me al &punctelev; þou haue merci of me!"
¶Þis holie man &slong;tod þarebiside &punctelev; and answerede him anon
beo doumb!" he seide "ich þe rede &punctelev; þat þou out of him gon
Þe deuel fleuȝ anon with þat w&orrot;d &punctelev; out of him in þulke place
And þe sike man[al. om.] bicam hol and sound &punctelev; anon þ&orrot;uȝ godes Godes grace
Þat folk &slong;tod al in gret wonder &punctelev; þo hu&ydot; iseiȝen þis cas
And biheolden þene holie man &punctelev; þat of swuch power was
And tolden wide þis holie dede &punctelev; þat ne miȝte nouȝt beo ihud
In þusse manere seint Seint Barthelmevȝ &punctelev; was f&orrot;me&slong;t in Inde ikud
Pollimius hiet þe k&ydot;ng &punctelev; þat of þulke contreie was
Sone þe tiþingues to him comen &punctelev; of þat faire cas
he hadde ane douȝter þat was lunat&ydot;ke &punctelev; þat þe deuel hadde muche with to done
And made hire witles[al. biwit] euerech monthþe &punctelev; ase hit feol in þe &slong;tat of þe mone
he sente to þis holie man &punctelev; seint Barthelmevȝ wel sone
Þat he of is douȝter hadde reouþe &punctelev; and hele hire þ&orrot;uȝ is bone
Þudere wende þis holie man &punctelev; and þis ma&ydot;de founde
Bitinde alle þat neiȝ hire come &punctelev; and grenninde fa&slong;te ibounde
Þis holie man &slong;tod and biheold &punctelev; þene deuel he made out wiende
hire riȝte wit heo hadde anon &punctelev; euereft to hire liues ende
Welle glad was hire fader þo &punctelev; and elles it were with wouȝ
he liet fette f&orrot;th riche cloþus &punctelev; and gold and seluer inouȝ
And liet chargi Camailes þarewith &punctelev; and with riche ȝim&slong;tones also
to p&rrot;esenti with þis holie man &punctelev; þat swuch dede hadde ido
Ake þare nas non þat miȝte him finde &punctelev; þo hu&ydot; comen with al þis p&rrot;u&ydot;te
Þarebi he miȝten onder&slong;tonde &punctelev; þat he þarof tolde lu&ydot;te
And þo no man ne miȝte him finde &punctelev; hit ofþouȝte s&orrot;e þe k&ydot;ngue
Ake nathþeles þis holie man &punctelev; ne f&orrot;ȝat him of none þingue
A niȝt ase he lai in his bed &punctelev; and on him fa&slong;te þouȝte
Þis holie man &slong;tod him bif&orrot;e &punctelev; he nu&slong;te ho him þudere b&rrot;ouȝte
Sire king" he seide "ȝwat was þe &punctelev; to siende me swuch p&rrot;u&ydot;te?
Þov ne paide&slong;t me riȝt nouȝt þarewith &punctelev; f&orrot; ich tolde þarof lu&ydot;te
Ake þat tres&orrot; þat ich of telle &punctelev; þat is heouene riche
Þat ne rou&slong;tez ne apeirez nouȝt &punctelev; ake euere w&orrot;thþ iliche
And f&orrot;to techen eov of godes Godes lawe &punctelev; hidere ich am icome
And makie eov leten eouwer false godes Godes &punctelev; and lieuen on godes Godes sone;[v. 1212 al. om.]
F&orrot;to techen eov þulke lawe &punctelev; hidere ich am ib&rrot;ouȝt
And maken eov leten ouwer false godes Godes &punctelev; þat ne mouwen eov helpe nouȝt
And ȝif þou nelt nouȝt of þusse þingue &punctelev; ilieue þat hit soth beo
Cum with me to ouwer false god &punctelev; and þov schalt þe soþe iseo
Þe king wende þo f&orrot;th with him &punctelev; to h&orrot;e false god anon
he&orrot;e luþere p&rrot;eo&slong;tes hu&ydot; founden þere &punctelev; bif&orrot;e him mani on
And duden to him he&orrot;e sacrefise &punctelev; ase hu&ydot; weren iwoned to done
Þe deuel þat witinne him was &punctelev; wel loude he gradde sone
And seide "ȝe wrechches leteth anon &punctelev; and ne Anourieth me riȝt nouȝt
la&slong;te ȝe beon in swuch t&orrot;ment &punctelev; ase ich am inne ib&rrot;ouȝt!
F&orrot; Iesu cri&slong;tes Aungeles &punctelev; þat þe giwes to deþe b&rrot;ouȝte
here beoth fa&slong;te aboute me &punctelev; and b&rrot;ingueth me alto nouȝte
with b&rrot;enninde raketeiȝes &punctelev; hu&ydot; habbeth me fa&slong;te ibounde
Þ&orrot;uȝ power of he&orrot;e heiȝe louerd &punctelev; þat þe giwes ȝeuen deþes wounde
And he þareaftur þane þridde da&ydot; &punctelev; so weilawei þe &slong;tounde
Fram deþe to liue he aros &punctelev; and b&rrot;ouȝte us alle to grounde
And in eche side his apo&slong;tles sende &punctelev; to p&rrot;echie godes Godes name
And on of heom is nouþe here &punctelev; þ&orrot;uȝ ȝwam ich habbe þis schame
¶Þat folk &slong;tod and biheold aboute &punctelev; and nu&slong;ten ȝwuch he was
Seint Barthelmevȝ &slong;tod and siȝte s&orrot;e &punctelev; and ofte seide alas
And seide "nouþe ȝe mouwen iseo &punctelev; ȝwuch lijf ȝe ledeth her
And in ȝwuch a god ȝe bilieueth &punctelev; and ȝwuch is his pouwer!
Ȝif ȝe wollez þat ich bidde f&orrot; eov &punctelev; mine louerd þat us bouȝte
Draweth adoun ouwer Maumat &punctelev; ant tob&rrot;ekez him alto nouȝte!"
Þo þe king ihe&orrot;de þis &punctelev; his men he hiet echon
Abouten him ca&slong;ten &slong;trongue ropes &punctelev; and d&rrot;awen him adoun anon
Þat folk was þo redi anon &punctelev; and ropes ca&slong;ten on him inowe
Ake hu&ydot; ne miȝten him nouȝt enes wawie &punctelev; f&orrot; al þat hu&ydot; alle d&rrot;owe
Doth awei" quath seint Seint Barthelmev &punctelev; "and ouwer ropes nimez adoun!"
And þo þe schrewe onbounde was &punctelev; seint Barthelmevȝ seide is &orrot;esoun
Þou deuel" he seide "þat ha&slong;t bitraid &punctelev; þus muche folk echon
Ȝif þou wolt þat Ine make þe nouȝt &punctelev; to þe putte of helle gon
wiend out anon mid[al. of] þulke fourme &punctelev; and b&rrot;ec hit alto nouȝte!"
Þe deuel anon with þulke w&orrot;de &punctelev; wel narewe is wei he souȝte
And tob&rrot;u&ydot;sde al þat wrechche maumat &punctelev; and wiende[MS. wiend þe] out þarof anon
And alle þe maumates of þe temple &punctelev; heo todaschten euerechon
Al þat folk &slong;tod and þis iseiȝ &punctelev; and wel loude bigonne to crie
And seiden "þare nis bote on almiȝti god &punctelev; ib&orrot;en of þe ma&ydot;de marie!"
Seint Barthelmeu criede on Iesu cri&slong;t &punctelev; and bad is &orrot;esoun
An Aungel cam so b&rrot;iȝt so sonne &punctelev; fram heouene liȝte adoun
to þe four hu&ydot;rnes he fleuȝ aboute &punctelev; and in euereche he d&rrot;ouȝ
with his finger a wel fair croiz &punctelev; apert and cler inouȝ
Mi louerd" he seide "me sende hidere &punctelev; and ase he himseolf me sede
Þis temple ichulle bif&orrot;e eou alle &punctelev; clansi of eche fu&ydot;lþehede
Ake ichulle nouþe f&orrot;me&slong;t þene deuel &punctelev; to eov alle schewen iwis
Þat ȝe mouwen þe soþe isco &punctelev; ȝwuch ouwer bileue is
Ake þei he beo grislich f&orrot;to biholde &punctelev; ne habbez of him no doute
Ake swuch signe ase ich habbe imaud &punctelev; in þeos four hu&ydot;rnes aboute
Makiez þulke sulue signe &punctelev; in ouwer f&orrot;eheued echon
And ech luþur þing euereft schal &punctelev; fram eou fleon oþur gon
Þo maden hu&ydot; alle in he&orrot;e f&orrot;eheued &punctelev; þe fourme of þe rode
And þe Aungel heom scheuwede al ab&rrot;od &punctelev; þene deuel ase hu&ydot; &slong;tode
Þe fourme of a grislich man &punctelev; þat al f&orrot;b&rrot;oide were
And swartt&orrot;e þane euere ani blouȝman &punctelev; with foule farinde chere
A scharp face he hadde and al f&orrot;kroked &punctelev; his berd atelich and long
Eiȝene b&rrot;ode al b&rrot;enninde &punctelev; red and swart among
Anon to is fiet tilde is her &punctelev; and after þe schrewe sum it d&rrot;ouȝ
his hondene bihinden him at his rug &punctelev; hu&ydot; weren þare wel inouȝ
Fu&ydot;rie speldene al &slong;tinkende &punctelev; out of is mouth he bla&slong;te
And fu&ydot;r of b&rrot;um&slong;ton at his nose &punctelev; þat &slong;tonk also foule and fa&slong;te
Croked was boþe nose and mouth &punctelev; wrechchede was his bone
And bote it[al. þis] were and[r. ane] hendi bacheler &punctelev; abid f&orrot;to eftsone!
Daiþet habbe swuch a louerding &punctelev; and alle þat him wel loue!
Ȝeot þei þe schrewe gret pouwer habbe &punctelev; god is euere aboue
¶Þou luþere þing" quath þis Aungel &punctelev; "þat here art nouþe onder me
F&orrot; þou dude&slong;t Barthelmeus he&slong;te &punctelev; ichulle habbe reuþe of þe
Ichulle þe onbinde and late þe fleo &punctelev; on e&orrot;þe in eche ende
F&orrot;to þe dai of dame[r. dome] come &punctelev; þat þou to helle iwiende
Þo þis luþere be&slong;t onbounde was &punctelev; with wel grisliche bere
he fleuȝ awei among heom alle &punctelev; and neuereft ne cam þere
Þo þe Aungel hadde al þis ido &punctelev; to heouene[MS. heouene heuene] he wende an heiȝ
Ȝe&orrot;ne criede ech of heom &punctelev; þat al þis wonder iseiȝ
And hereden god and þene Aungel also &punctelev; þat þare among heo[m] cam
hu&ydot; crieden euere on seint Seint Barthelmev &punctelev; þat he ȝeue heom cri&slong;tindom
So þat al þat ilke lond &punctelev; to cri&slong;tinedom was ib&rrot;ouȝt þo
Þ&orrot;uȝ þe Aungele and seint Seint
barthelmev Barthelmev &punctelev; iblessede beon hu&ydot; bo![v. 1978 al. om.]
Pollimius with is Quene &punctelev; alle is child&rrot;ene he nam
And liet heom[on the margin.] baptizen of seint Seint
barthelmevȝ &punctelev; and sethþe al is kinedom
So þat al þat ilke lond &punctelev; to cri&slong;tinedom was ib&rrot;ouȝt
Þe king f&orrot;sok al is lond &punctelev; and ne tolde þarof riȝt nouȝt
And wende and siwede seint Seint
Barthelmeuȝ &punctelev; and p&rrot;echede with him wel fa&slong;te
And bicam swiþe holi man &punctelev; and was bischop at þe la&slong;te
¶Ane b&rrot;oþer herre k&ydot;ng þane he was &punctelev; he hadde of grete p&rrot;u&ydot;te
A&slong;triages was is name &punctelev; þarebiside a lu&ydot;te
Þe t&ydot;þingue of seint Seint
Barthelmeuȝ &punctelev; wel sone to him cam
Alhou he hadde þene king is b&rrot;oþer &punctelev; iturned to cri&slong;tinedam
A þousend men wel jArmede &punctelev; After him he sende
F&orrot;to enqueri into al þat lond &punctelev; ȝwoderward he wende
hu&ydot; wenden and souȝten him ful &slong;tu&ydot;rneliche &punctelev; and þo he was ifounde
bif&orrot;e he&orrot;e kingue A&slong;triages &punctelev; hu&ydot; b&rrot;ouȝten him fa&slong;te ibounde
And swiþe ofte he was with heom ipult &punctelev; þat he feol adoun to grounde.[v. 213 al. om.]
¶Bel ami seide A&slong;triages þe king &punctelev; "hou haue&slong;t þou on itake?
ha&slong;t þou mine b&rrot;oþur with tricherie &punctelev; imaked mi godes Godes f&orrot;sake
bi þe fei þat i schal to mahun &punctelev; ichulle serui þe also
And make þe bileue þine false god &punctelev; oþur to &slong;trongue deþe þe do
And ȝeot þeof m&orrot;e schame opon oþur &punctelev; ase ich ihe&orrot;e[ich ihe&orrot;e al. om.] bi mannes sawe
Þov ha&slong;t &orrot;e godes Godes ellesȝware &punctelev; defoulet and altod&rrot;awe
¶Sire king quath seint Seint Barthelmeuȝ &punctelev; "þou ne sei&slong;t nouȝt as þe hiende
Þat i scholde with tricherie &punctelev; þine b&rrot;oþeres he&orrot;te wiende
with no tricherie ne wende ich him &punctelev; ake with sothþenesse and with riȝte
Ich b&rrot;ouȝte him out of misbileue &punctelev; to him þat [hath][om.] alle miȝte
Fram þe godes Godes þat beoth also miȝtelese &punctelev; ase is þat dede treo
Þat ich liet altod&rrot;awe. &punctelev; and ȝif þou wolt þe soþe iseo
bring me to þine oþur god &punctelev; and ȝif ich mai don swuch dede
Ilief wel þat he is miȝteles &punctelev; and f&orrot;sak þou him ich rede
And with þulke god þat ich on bilieue &punctelev; ȝif þou miȝt so on take
Ich rede þat þou ac&orrot;di þe &punctelev; and þine owene god f&orrot;sake;[al. Ich þe bihote truliche &punctelev; þat ich him wole f&orrot;sake.]
And ȝif þat ich mai þ&orrot;u &slong;trencþe of mi louerd &punctelev; þinne god ouercome
F&orrot;sak þe wrechches ase hu&ydot; beoth wu&ydot;rþe &punctelev; f&orrot; he&orrot;e miȝte heom is binome
Nadde he bote þis w&orrot;d iseid &punctelev; þat þare ne cam to þe kingue
A messager wel ha&slong;teliche &punctelev; þat b&rrot;ouȝte him ful s&orrot;i tiþingue
Þat berit is owene god &punctelev; þat he wel ofte souȝte
was ifalle of þe temple adoun &punctelev; and al todascht to nouȝte
¶Þo þe king ihe&orrot;de þis &punctelev; s&orrot;i he was inouȝ
he fierde ase a man þat witles were &punctelev; and is cloþes al tod&rrot;ouȝ
he liet nime seint Seint
barthelmeu &punctelev; and t&orrot;menti him wel fa&slong;te
And with grete &slong;taues legge on him &punctelev; þe ȝw&ydot;le hu&ydot; wolden ila&slong;te
Þo he was defoulet so &punctelev; þat reouþe it was to wite
Ase we findez in some &slong;tude &punctelev; of his liue iwrite
¶He liet him don on a rode &punctelev; is heued toward þe grounde
Fiet and hondene to þe treo &punctelev; inailled and fa&slong;te[al. oþer] ibounde
And seth to don him m&orrot;e pine &punctelev; ase we findez iw[r]ite also
Þo he hadde þeron ihonged longue &punctelev; he liet him adoun do
And liet hu&ydot;lden is fel al fram is flechs &punctelev; al quik with kene kn&ydot;ue
Riȝt ase men hu&ydot;ldeth a ded oxe &punctelev; men hulden him aliue
Alas hou miȝten hu&ydot; habben þe he&orrot;te &punctelev; alas þe deolfulle pine
louerd muche is þi miȝte &punctelev; ase þov scheoude&slong;t þare bi þine hine
Atþe la&slong;te þo he was ihuld &punctelev; ase we findez iwriten also
hu&ydot; smiten of is holie heued &punctelev; are hu&ydot; miȝten him to deþe do
Vnneþe hu&ydot; miȝten mid al þis wo &punctelev; bringue is lijf to fine
Muche wonder was þat ani lijf miȝte &punctelev; on e&orrot;þe þolie swuch pine![v. 2523 al. om.]
his bodi was þ&orrot;uȝ cri&slong;tine men &punctelev; ibured faire inouȝ
Wel þicke ase hu&ydot; d&orrot;&slong;ten &punctelev; þat folk þudereward d&rrot;ouȝ
F&orrot; &orrot;e louerd anonriȝt f&orrot; is loue &punctelev; fair miracle þare sende
Ȝwaref&orrot;e guode men þareaboute &punctelev; wel þicke þudere wende
¶Þe luþere king A&slong;triages &punctelev; þat him liet so aquelle
he d&rrot;adde him sumdel of þe miracles &punctelev; þo he he&orrot;de þarof telle
Þane þreotteoþe dai þareafterward &punctelev; þat he liet him martri þere
Alle þe grete mai&slong;tres he nam with him &punctelev; þat of þe temple were
And to is toumbe hu&ydot; wenden alle &punctelev; þare ase þat holie bodi lai
Anon so hu&ydot; þudere comen &punctelev; ase al þat folk isa&ydot;
Þe deuel þat he&orrot;e mai&slong;ter was &punctelev; t&orrot;mentede heom anon
F&orrot; wreche of þat holie man &punctelev; hu&ydot; bicomen gu&ydot;die echon[MS. æchon]
And ase f&orrot;l&orrot;ene wrechches hu&ydot; deiden þo &punctelev; he ne liet heom no leng gon
Into helle þe soulene with him he nam &punctelev; þare ne liet he nouȝt on
¶Þe t&ydot;þingue was sone wide ib&rrot;ouȝt. &punctelev; hu&ydot; d&rrot;adden heom wel s&orrot;e
Þat of misbileue weren &punctelev; hu&ydot; ne d&orrot;&slong;ten þo nonm&orrot;e
Ake hu&ydot; f&orrot;soken h&orrot;e false lawe &punctelev; and beden &orrot;e louerdes &orrot;e
And lieten heom cri&slong;tni euerechone &punctelev; þ&orrot;uȝ seint Seint
Barthelmeus l&orrot;e
POllonius þat k&ydot;ng was er &punctelev; and þat to &orrot;e louerdes lawe him nam
bischop hu&ydot; maden him ouer heom alle &punctelev; to holden op cri&slong;tindom
he was bischop twenti ȝer &punctelev; are he dude heonne iwiende
to þe Io&ydot;e of heouene is soule wende &punctelev; atþe twenti ȝeres ende.[v. 276311 om. in Ashm. & Vern.]
Þare was of seint Seint
Barthelmeuȝ &punctelev; Miracles euere inowe
And wel þicke alaboute to is toumbe &punctelev; muche folk euere d&rrot;owe
Ȝeot þare weren luþere men bileued &punctelev; and hadden þa[r]to envie
Þat he biliefden nouȝt þat &orrot;e louerd was ib&orrot;e &punctelev; of þe maidene Marie
A veteles hu&ydot; maden al of led &punctelev; and þareinne hu&ydot; ca&slong;te
Þis holi bodi wel fijlliche &punctelev; and dutten it sw&ydot;þe fa&slong;te
And amidde þe se ca&slong;ten hit &punctelev; and wolden deliueren heom so
Ake ȝeot &orrot;e louerd cudde is miȝte &punctelev; ase he hath ofte ido
F&orrot; þat ilke led aȝein is ku&ydot;nde &punctelev; þei it vuele were is riȝte
Aboue þe watere it gan to fleote &punctelev; þare was godes Godes miȝte
F&orrot; þat watur nadde power non &punctelev; to holden it to þe grounde
to þe cite of lupar it flet &punctelev; and þare it was fur&slong;t ifounde
And of cri&slong;tine men op Inome &punctelev; and faire on e&orrot;þe ib&rrot;ouȝt
Ȝeot &orrot;e louerd þei he were þare &punctelev; he ne f&orrot;ȝat him riȝt nouȝt
F&orrot; he sende miracles riuedeliche &punctelev; aboute þe bodie þere
Atþe la&slong;te some luþere men &punctelev; þat in þe londe were
hadden þarto ȝeot gret onde &punctelev; and in a t&ydot;me bi&slong;telen þareto
And nomen þe bones up fram þe &slong;tude &punctelev; þat hu&ydot; weren inne ido
And in þe contreie aboute heom bere &punctelev; and ca&slong;ten euerech in his side
Some in one &slong;tude and some in oþur &punctelev; and tosp&rrot;adden heom so wel wide
F&orrot; hu&ydot; ne scholden neuereft togadere come &punctelev; ne m&orrot;e miracle do
So[al. om.] longue ase godes Godes wille was &punctelev; defoulede hu&ydot; weren so.
SEint Barthelmeuȝ cam sethþe &punctelev; to a monek þarebiside
Mine bones he seide beoth ica&slong;t &punctelev; and altosp&rrot;adde wel wide
Inelle nonm&orrot;e þat hu&ydot; beon so &punctelev; þaref&orrot;e þou mo&slong;t gon
Þis n&ydot;ȝt aboute þare hu&ydot; beoth &punctelev; and togadere heom b&rrot;ingue echon
A sire merci þis Monek monek seide &punctelev; hou scholde ich iknowe heom nov?"
Swiþe wel seide þis holie man &punctelev; and ichulle þe tellen hou
Euerech of heom þare hu&ydot; liggez &punctelev; þei it de&orrot;k niȝt beo
Sch&ydot;ne schullen ase b&rrot;iȝte ase sonne &punctelev; þat wel fe&orrot; þou schalt heom iseo
¶Þis Monek monek wende f&orrot;th bi niȝte &punctelev; he ne fond of heom nouȝt on
Þat hu&ydot; ne schinen ase clere ase ani sonne. &punctelev; and so he gaderede heom echon
In a schip he b&rrot;ouȝte heom in þe se &punctelev; with gret honour atþenende
Þat ȝwodereso &orrot;e louerd wolde &punctelev; þ&orrot;uȝ is wille [he] heom sende
A w&ydot;nd þare cam and d&rrot;of þat schip &punctelev; softe and euene inouȝ
So þat to þe londe of apu&ydot;le &punctelev; þat schip wel euene d&rrot;ouȝ
Þare weren þe bones faire onderfongue &punctelev; and faire in schrine ido
Mani fair Miracle þare comen sone &punctelev; And ȝeot þare doth also
Bidde we nouþe seint Seint
Barthelmevȝ &punctelev; þat heiȝ Apo&slong;tle is
Þat we moten þ&orrot;uȝ his bone &punctelev; come to heouene blis. AmeN
